pullRequest.body:
The "countHeartbeats" linter counts the heartbeats of every declaration.

The effect of the linter is similar to `#count_heartbeats in xxx`, except that it applies
to all declarations.

Note that the linter only counts heartbeats in "top-level" declarations:
it looks inside `set_option ... in`, but not, for instance, inside `mutual` blocks.

There is a convenience notation `#count_heartbeats` that simply sets the linter option to true.

*Note*.  I also renamed `count_heartbeats ...` to `#count_heartbeats ...`.

[Zulip](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/channel/287929-mathlib4/topic/count_heartbeats.20for.20all.20declarations.20in.20a.20file.3F)

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

### PR summary [7c5021060d](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/20421/commits/7c5021060d90008fdd50ba71a4a4c0186ace792d)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ XY`
`+ XY'`
`+ YX`
`+ YX'`
`+ countHeartbeatsLinter`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

thanks!

maintainer merge
ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by joneugster.

Sorry for the late feature request, but since count_hearbeats now produces a list of messages in the infoview, it would be helpful to include the decl name with each message. (There is the line number but it takes some time to look it up.)

@alreadydone great suggestion, thanks!  I just pushed a version that also prints the declaration name, if there is one.  For nameless `instance`s, the linter makes no effort to retrieve the actual name.

Got it, thanks! I think this looks ready for merging then :D

bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/12745967560/job/35521037531)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/12745967560/job/35521037845)
is it really useful to have this instead of simply writing `set_option linter.countHeartbeats true`? The latter seems more idiomatic
if you'd prefer to keep it, could you rename it to `count_heartbeats`, so that it matches `count_heartbeats in _`?

I think that for discoverability, the alternative spelling `count_heartbeats` could be useful.  In the long run, it probably does not matter either way.  I'll poll mathlib, to see if there are strong views either way.
Your reason to add the command makes sense, especially after I noticed that `count_heartbeats in` is valid already

```suggestion
The effect of the linter is similar to `count_hearbeats in xxx`, except that it applies
```
Thanks!  I was really convinced that there was a `#` in the other command.  Also, fixing this, I noticed an extra spelling mistake in that command!  :facepalm:
what's the point of the duplication? If I clone the file, it seems to work fine with just one of the two.

I was just testing that `withSetOptionIn` crawled inside *all* `set_option`s, not just the outermost one.

I probably prefer to keep the repetition, even if it is not strictly a test of `count_heartbeats`.
Maybe worth adding a comment if you keep it since it is confusing at first glance.
Comment added, thanks for the suggestion!

```suggestion
  match stx.find? (Â·.isOfKind ``Parser.Command.declId) with
    | some decl =>
      for msg in msgs do logInfoAt decl m!"'{decl[0].getId}' {(â† msg.toString).decapitalize}"
    | none =>
      for msg in msgs do logInfoAt stx m!"{â† msg.toString}"
```

how about this in order to use `String.decapitalize`?
Thanks for the suggestion: I did not know about `decapitalize`.
Would it be possible to keep the old syntax as e.g. a deprecated macro? I think this may be confusing otherwise if someone doesn't notice this change
I just added a deprecation, thanks!

```suggestion
The "countHeartbeats" linter counts the heartbeats of every declaration.
```

I am a bit confused: do I understand correctly that both `set_option linter.countHeartbeats true` and `#count_heartbeats` do the same? Maybe we should have two different sections in the test file, so they run individually?

Your understanding is correct: there is a discussion/poll [here](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/channel/287929-mathlib4/topic/count_heartbeats.20for.20all.20declarations.20in.20a.20file.3F/near/492959598) about the appropriateness of the two spellings.

I also now used two sections for testing the two commands.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: `#count_heartbeats` for all declarations
